headline: What the Big Oil executives told Trump about investing in Venezuela
summary: The CEOs of Exxon and Conoco are wary of returning to Venezuela. Chevron is ready to quickly ramp up production.

raw.headline: What the Big Oil executives told Trump about investing in Venezuela
raw.summary: The CEOs of Exxon and Conoco are wary of returning to Venezuela. Chevron is ready to quickly ramp up production.

headline: An Oil Exec on ‘Landman,’ Venezuela, and Beating the S&P 500
summary: Mark Lashier, CEO of Phillips 66, also spoke about the energy company’s new directors and its relationship with the activist investor Elliott Management.  The Houston-based oil and gas company  Phillips 66  is named after the bygone era of early American automobiles that drove Route 66—and were fueled by Phillips Petroleum’s 66 octane gasoline.  Phillips Petroleum later merged into  ConocoPhillips  When ConocoPhillips split in two in 2012, Phillips 66 was created.

The Houston-based oil and gas company  Phillips 66  is named after the bygone era of early American automobiles that drove Route 66—and were fueled by Phillips Petroleum’s 66 octane gasoline. headline: Trump to Big Oil: Spend $100 Billion in Venezuela. No Government Cash.
summary: President Donald Trump told big oil companies like  Chevron Exxon Mobil  and  ConocoPhillips  that he expects them to spend heavily to rebuild Venezuela’s oil industry, and that they shouldn’t expect financial support from the government.  “The plan is for them to spend—meaning our giant oil companies will be spending at least $100 billion of their money, not the government’s money,” Trump said.

headline: Trump pushes for $100 billion in oil investments in Venezuela while Exxon and others say it’s currently ‘uninvestable’ without major reforms
summary: Oil giants tell Trump they need stability and considerable legal and political reforms before investing big in Venezuela.
